Jean-Talon Street / Fabre Street[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/Fabre.pdf Map] |}} '''Fabre''' is a station on the [[Line 5 Blue (Montreal Metro)|Blue Line]] of the [[Montreal Metro]] [[Rapid transit|rapid transit system]], operated by the [[SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al]] (STM). It is located on the [[Villeray]] neighborhood in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]].[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m62.htm Fabre Metro Station] == Overview == It is a normal [[side platform]] station with two entrances: one on rue Fabre and another on avenue Papineau. The brightly coloured murals and continuous handrail were designed by artist [[Jean-NoÃ«l Poliquin]]. ==Origin of name== Fabre is named for the nearby rue Fabre. The street name honours Monseigneur Ãdouard-Charles Fabre (1827â1896), Montreal's first archbishop (1886). ==Connecting bus routes== {{Main|SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al}} {{Main|List of Montreal Bus Routes}}
